author: Kolby Terrell
title: Texas dust, tree pollen affecting Oklahoman's allergies
text:
Texas dust, tree pollen affecting Oklahoman’s allergies
Dust blowing in from Texas and high winds could mean bad allergies from many across the Sooner state.
Dust blowing in from Texas and high winds could mean bad allergies from many across the Sooner state.
Dust blowing in from Texas and high winds could mean bad allergies from many across the Sooner state.
Dust blowing in from Texas and high winds could mean bad allergies from many across the Sooner state.
Allergy doctors have said they’re already busy and gave insight into what residents can expect from storm season.
If your allergies are acting up right now, you’re not alone, but it may not be from the usual offenders.
This week, you may be feeling the effects of dust settling in from Texas.
“They do come this way, we’ve seen ‘em this weekend and they’re still here somewhat present at this point,” said Dr. Dean Atkinson, with the Oklahoma Allergy and Asthma Clinic.
A dust cloud that’s traveled across Texas is now hitting Oklahomans. So, what kind of effects will we feel?
“Anytime we get irritants like dust in the air, it definitely makes symptoms of allergies more severe,” Atkinson said.
Patients are stacking up and doctors don’t expect that to stop any time soon with storm season pushing pollen around.
“Pollens actually require wind to keep them up in the air. They’re fairly heavy particles and if they don’t have wind they don’t stay up in the air and that’s one of the reasons why Oklahoma is such a heavy allergy-type environment,” Atkinson said.
Get the latest news stories of interest by clicking here.
High winds in recent days across Oklahoma aren’t just carrying Texas dust, there are also tree allergens spiking right now.
“This is the time of year that we typically have a whole lot of elm and cedars also carrying through,” Atkinson said.
The advice to avoid symptoms might seem simple, but Atkinson said it’s effective.
“If you can at all just try to stay away from the outside, especially when it’s real windy like this,” Atkinson said.
He also recommends grabbing an over-the-counter antihistamine if you’re having a flare-up.

author: Decatur Daily Democrat
title: "KNEELING ON BROKEN GLASS: The Chronicles of Ezekiel’s Riders" - A Journey of Faith and Service Launches This Easter Sunday | News | decaturdailydemocrat.com
text: --News Direct-- This Easter Sunday, as we celebrate the resurrection and the promise of renewal, Great Commission United is thrilled to announce the release of "KNEELING ON BROKEN GLASS: The Chronicles of Ezekiel’s Riders." This compelling new book, authored by Joseph Palumbo and William Hodge, is a testament to the power of faith, the strength of the human spirit, and the profound impact of serving others in the name of Christ. In a world craving hope and spiritual nourishment, "KNEELING ON BROKEN GLASS" arrives as a beacon of light. The book chronicles the journey of the Ezekiel Riders, a group of chaplains committed to fulfilling the Great Commission through acts of service and discipleship across the globe. From the streets of local communities to the far reaches of the world, their mission is a powerful reminder of the impact one can make when led by faith and compassion. About the Authors: Joseph Palumbo is a dedicated servant leader whose life has been a testament to the transformative power of faith and service. With over five decades of ministry, Joseph's journey from a U.S. Military Police officer to a founder of a coffee shop ministry showcases his unwavering commitment to helping those in need. William Hodge's path from aspiring police officer to a beacon of hope and restoration underscores the remarkable ways in which faith can change lives. William's divine encounter at a young age set him on a lifelong mission to spread the message of salvation and healing, culminating in his leadership of Great Commission United Chaplaincy and Discipleship Academy. He Has Risen, Hallelujah: Launching on Easter Sunday, "KNEELING ON BROKEN GLASS" is not just a book release; it's an invitation to be part of a movement that echoes the message of Easter - renewal, hope, and the promise of new life. As we commemorate the resurrection, let this book inspire you to rise above challenges, serve with love, and embark on your own journey of faith. Be Part of the Journey: Join Joseph Palumbo, William Hodge, and the Ezekiel Riders in their mission to spread the Gospel and serve those in need. "KNEELING ON BROKEN GLASS" is now available at www.kneelingonbrokenglass.com . Purchase your copy today, share your story, and discover how you can make a difference in the world, one act of faith at a time. For more information, to request a review copy, or to schedule an interview with the authors, please contact [riders@kneelingonbrokenglass.com](mailto:riders@kneelingonbrokenglass.com). author: Jorge Luis Pinedo Barrera
title: COVID-19: Gobierno no prohibirá reuniones ni fiestas de Año Nuevo pese a incremento de contagios | RPP Noticias
text: El jefe del Gabinete Ministerial, [Alberto Otárola](https://rpp.pe/noticias/alberto-otarola), afirmó en conferencia de prensa que las actividades por el recibimiento del [Año Nuevo 2024](https://rpp.pe/noticias/ano-nuevo) podrán realizarse a pesar [del incremento de contagios de la COVID-19 en varias partes del Perú](https://rpp.pe/peru/actualidad/covid-19-minsa-deteca-incremento-de-casos-en-costas-sur-y-norte-ademas-del-oriente-del-pais-noticia-1524319). [Alberto Otárola](https://rpp.pe/noticias/alberto-otarola), presidente del Consejo de Ministros, afirmó que el Gobierno no prohibirá las reuniones ni fiestas por [Año Nuevo](https://rpp.pe/noticias/ano-nuevo), pese al incremento de contagios de la [COVID-19](https://rpp.pe/noticias/covid-19) registrados en las últimas semanas en diversas regiones del país, además [de los primeros 12 casos detectados del nuevo linaje JN.1](https://rpp.pe/peru/actualidad/ins-identifica-12-casos-del-linaje-jn1-de-la-covid-19-en-el-peru-noticia-1524343). Al respecto, el jefe del Gabinete Ministerial aseguró que “la enfermedad está controlada” y exhortó a la población a completar el esquema de vacunación contra la COVID-19 y cumplir las medidas de prevención contra la transmisión del virus. “No habrá ninguna medida restrictiva, la población tiene programada sus reuniones de fin de año, no se suspenderá ninguna actividad, pero sí reitero el llamado para cuidarnos y vacunarnos. La mejor medida que uno pueda tomar es ponerse la vacuna bivalente, hay suficientes en todo el Perú”, señaló Otárola en conferencia de prensa tras realizarse una nueva sesión del Consejo de Ministros. Hace un llamado a la calma Por otra parte, el ministro de [Salud](https://rpp.pe/noticias/ministerio-de-salud), César Vásquez, señaló que era previsible el aumento de contagios por este virus debido al cambio de estación y a la aglomeración de personas producto de las fiestas de fin de año. En esa línea, el titular del Minsa precisó que hasta noviembre el promedio de casos por semanas era entre 600 y 700, mientras que en diciembre la cifra se elevó por semana a 1700. "Este aumento es más o menos el triple de lo normal, pero no ha significado un incremento de hospitalizaciones por esta causa. La COVID-19 trajo dolor y muerte en su momento, pero en la actualidad todos prácticamente ya tienen defensas contra este virus, algunos por respuesta natural de su cuerpo y otros inducidos por la vacuna", afirmó. "Quiero llamar a la calma a la ciudadanía, que sigan con su vida normal, pero si hay síntomas como tos, resfrío, fiebre, pérdida del gusto, es decir, síntomas compatibles con la COVID, hay que usar mascarilla básicamente para no contagiar a un adulto mayor vulnerable y sin vacunar porque para él sí podría ser mortal", agregó. Te recomendamos Comparte esta noticia [Siguenos en](https://news.google.com/publications/CAAiEPS-1PTwo1fhyncujsNXKmcqFAgKIhD0vtT08KNX4cp3Lo7DVypn?hl=es-419&gl=PE&ceid=PE%3Aes-419)

author: Joe Lombardi
title: Recall Issued For Popular Snack Brands In 36 States, Including NY - NewsBreak
text: Consumers in multiple states are being urged to check their snack cabinets after a major recall affecting a popular brand of biscuits, wafers, and snack rolls. ZB Importing LLC is voluntarily recalling certain lots of six varieties of Ulker Brand snack products due to undeclared wheat, egg, and/or milk in the ingredient list and/or "Contains" statement on product labels. People with allergies or severe sensitivities to these ingredients could experience serious or life-threatening reactions if they consume the affected items. Affected Distribution Areas Products were distributed through retail stores in Ontario, Canada, and the following states: View Product Labels Here The issue was discovered after a consumer reported an allergic reaction linked to one of the recalled products. According to the company, the mislabeling originated from a supplier who failed to fully disclose all allergens during the translation of ingredient lists. In response, ZB Importing is implementing stricter labeling controls and an additional verification process for multilingual packaging. Anyone who purchased the affected Ulker Brand products is advised to return them to the place of purchase for a full refund. Consumers with questions can contact the company at info@ziyad.com.

author: SABC News
title: Servere weather predicted for New Years weekend
text:
The South African Weather Service has issued severe weather warnings for several provinces, anticipating widespread rain and thunderstorms.
Forecaster Lehlohonolo Thobela says showers are expected across the country, with more concentrated and widespread thundershowers predicted for central regions, covering parts of Free State, the western Eastern Cape, most areas of the Northern Cape, and the western Northern West Province.
A level 4 warning has been issued for severe thunderstorms, indicating the likelihood of strong winds, heavy rain, flooding, and hail, particularly in the Northern Cape, North West, and southwestern Free State.
The Mangaung Metro in the Free State is cautioning residents about potential severe thunderstorms.
A Level 4 warning has been issued for heavy rains, estimated at 80%, in the metro’s jurisdiction on Friday afternoon.
Residents and road users are urged to heed alerts, reduce speed, use headlights, and exercise caution when crossing roads or near water bodies.
In KwaZulu-Natal, the South African Weather Service warns of heavy rainfall over the New Year’s weekend.
The Durban metro, Pietermaritzburg, Estcourt, Mooi River, Newcastle, Kokstad, and Port Shepstone are expected to experience increased rainfall and strong winds.
Forecaster Wisani Maluleke advises businesses and residents in low-lying areas to be vigilant as heavy rain may lead to flooding

author: Claudio Benites
title: Materiales sostenibles para el interior de la cabina del Pilatus PC-24
text:
Pilatus demostró su compromiso con la sostenibilidad, en el uso de materiales respetuosos con el medio ambiente en el interior de la cabina del PC-24 , incluidos aceites naturales en lugar de barnices sintéticos.
Equipado con tecnología de última generación, el PC-24 también ofrece a los pasajeros el máximo nivel de confort: una cabina luminosa y espaciosa, un piso plano, mano de obra de primera clase y una amplia selección de materiales.
En la NBAA-BACE 2024 en Las Vegas, Pilatus se asociará con F/LIST , un proveedor global de interiores de alta gama para jets privados y de negocios, para presentar la primera maqueta de un interior de cabina de PC-24 diseñado con materiales respetuosos con el medio ambiente.
El aceite natural transparente F/LAB no solo minimiza la liberación de compuestos orgánicos volátiles (VOC) nocivos al medio ambiente, sino que también resalta la belleza de las chapas de madera: el brillo mate y la veta tangible resaltan los patrones y remolinos naturales.
La superficie tratada con aceite está diseñada para durar; sus propiedades resistentes a los arañazos y las manchas facilitan el uso regular con un mantenimiento mínimo.
Natural y ecológico La mayoría de los tejidos que utiliza Pilatus en los lujosos interiores de hoy en día están hechos de fibras especiales. Son fáciles de limpiar y mantienen su forma después del lavado. El proceso de lavado requiere considerablemente menos agua y detergente, mientras que el secado rápido también consume menos energía. Además, el material se puede reciclar.
Otro ejemplo son las alfombras fabricadas íntegramente con lana natural. La lana virgen pura, al ser una fibra renovable y biodegradable, es uno de los materiales para suelos más limpios y respetuosos con el medio ambiente del mundo.
Para sus clientes más concienciados con el medio ambiente, Pilatus ofrece una colección de alfombras fabricadas sin ningún tipo de colorante artificial.
André Zimmermann , vicepresidente de aviación comercial de Pilatus , destaca: “Nos esforzamos por mejorar constantemente lo que ofrecemos a nuestros clientes y nos esforzamos por reducir nuestra huella medioambiental sin comprometer la calidad ni el rendimiento».
Agregó que Pilatus «lleva muchos años comprometida con la sostenibilidad y la eficiencia energética, por ejemplo en nuestros procesos de producción. Además, seguimos invirtiendo en combustible de aviación sostenible (SAF), que utilizamos para una parte de nuestra propia flota”.
PC-12 certificados para SAF Los aviones Pilatus ya están certificados para utilizar combustible de aviación sostenible (SAF), que actualmente se produce principalmente a partir de biomasa o materiales de desecho. Con el objetivo de acelerar la ampliación de los combustibles solares en la aviación, Pilatus y Synhelion anunciaron el inicio de su asociación estratégica en el verano de 2024.
En virtud del acuerdo de compra, Pilatus se ha comprometido a comprar 200 toneladas de combustible solar cada año durante cinco años, a partir de 2027. Pilatus planea utilizar el combustible de origen solar en su propia flota y tiene la intención de ofrecérselo a los clientes de PC-12 y PC-24 en una fecha posterior.

author: Finimize Newsroom
title: Amara Raja Faces Falling Profits As Battery Costs Climb
text:
Sponsored
This is a paid advertisement for Death & Company’s Regulation A offering. Past performance is not indicative of future results. Please read the offering circular at invest.deathandcompany.com.
Join the newsletter that everyone in finance secretly reads. 1M+ subscribers, 100% free.
What’s going on here?
Amara Raja Energy and Mobility’s quarterly profit slid 21% to 1.94 billion rupees ($22.2 million), with sluggish car sales and rising costs weighing on the battery maker—even as it gears up for electric vehicles.
What does this mean?
Best known for its Amaron car batteries, Amara Raja is feeling the squeeze from weak auto demand and climbing expenses. Revenue ticked up 7% to 33.5 billion rupees, but much of that was fueled by customers swapping out old batteries instead of carmakers ordering for new vehicles. Meanwhile, costs climbed even faster—up 10%—with analysts highlighting pricier energy bills that further squeezed margins. The company’s performance mirrors broader struggles among India’s traditional battery makers as the auto industry gradually pivots to electric mobility. Still, Amara Raja is investing in the shift, building a battery cell factory and assembling electric vehicle battery packs to better tap India’s growing EV market by 2027.
Why should I care?
For markets: Margins under pressure in a changing landscape.
Amara Raja’s profit dip spotlights the challenges legacy suppliers face as India’s auto scene slowly goes electric. Sales are inching upward, but higher input and energy costs are squeezing profits. Meanwhile, rival Exide is managing its bottom line more tightly, setting up an industry face-off as margins come under pressure. Investors will be watching which players can control costs and adapt as new technologies remake the sector.
The bigger picture: Electrification is rewriting the battery rulebook.
India’s electric vehicle momentum is changing the game for battery makers. Amara Raja’s push to expand cell manufacturing and EV battery packs signals a bid for longer-term growth—even as profits are pinched by short-term troubles. With batteries central to India’s clean energy ambitions, firms that pivot quickly and keep costs in check could shape the future face of the industry.

author: E! News
title: Big Sean Shares How He and Jhené Aiko Dealt With Grief After Experiencing a Miscarriage | Nestia
text: Big Sean is getting candid about a difficult time.The “Hate Our Love” rapper and his longtime girlfriend Jhené Aiko—who are parents to son Noah Hasani, 2—previously suffered a miscarriage, and he detailed the emotional time while issuing a heartfelt message to those who have faced similar experiences.
